intro: Quercus massana, commonly known as the Pyrenean oak, is a deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, acorn-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Quercus massana thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soils. Its ecological importance makes it a key species in forest ecosystems of the region.
